required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I/II Study of FP-045 in Patients With Fanconi Anemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2 Multicenter, Dose Escalation and Expansion Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Preliminary Activity of FP-045 in Patients With Fanconi Anemia

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 1 dose escalation in adolescents (ages 12-18 y.o.). Once safety established, dose escalation in pediatric subjects (3-11 y.o.) will follow. In expansion phase 20 adolescent or pediatric subjects will receive FP-045 at recommended phase 2 dose for 6 months.

detailed_description.textblock:
In Phase 1, 3 cohorts of 3 adolescent subjects each will receive one of 3 escalating dose levels of FP-045 for 28 days to determine safety and tolerability. Once safety evaluation at highest dose is complete, 3 cohorts of 6 pediatric subjects will receive one of 3 escalating dose levels of FP-045 to determine safety and tolerability. Subjects tolerating FP-045 well may go on to receive a total of 3 months of treatment.
In expansion, 20 additional subjects, adolescent and pediatric, will be enrolled and treated at the recommended phase 2 dose of FP-045 for their age group, for up to 6 months to study effects on hematologic parameters. All subjects will be followed closely with serial hematology and chemistry laboratory assessments, physical exams, and monitoring for adverse events. Samples for pharmacokinetics will be obtained, and multiple pharmacodynamic markers will be assessed periodically.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Phase 1 dose escalation followed by Phase 2 expanion

primary_outcome.description: The MTD of FP-045 in adolescent and pediatric subjects

secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of adverse events and serious adverse events
Mean AUC of FP-045 by dose level

arm_group.description: FP-045 at one of 3 dose levels to sequential cohorts of adolescent, followed by pediatric subjects

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male or female aged 3-18
- documented Fanconi anemia by chromosome breakage analysis
- females of child-bearing potential and males required to use highly effective birth control
Phase 2 only:
- mild to moderate bone marrow failure with at least one cytopenia of > grade 1 severity
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of any malignancy except focal squamous cell or basal cell carcinoma of the skin or carcinoma in situ of cervix
- has myelodysplastic syndrome or acute leukemia per world health organization (WHO) criteria
- has history of any significant medical conditions
- has aspartate aminotransferase (AST)/alanine aminotransferase (ALT) > 5x upper limit of normal (ULN) or calculated creatinine clearance (Clcr) of < 50 mL/min
- has active Hepatitis B or C
- has an ongoing systemic infection
- requires a strong CYP3A4 inhibitor
- has had major surgery within 30 days
Phase 1:
- Stem cell or bone marrow transplant within 3 months prior
- Active graft versus host disease requiring systemic treatment
Phase 2:
- Has a history of bone marrow or stem cell transplant
